nodes.documentation:
Modifiers are a convenient way to validate inputs to
 functions. `onlyBefore` is applied to `bid` below:
 The new function body is the modifier's body where
 `_` is replaced by the old function body.
nodes.name: onlyBefore

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => struct BlindAuction.Bid storage ref[] storage ref)
struct BlindAuction.Bid storage ref[] storage ref

nodes.documentation:
Place a blinded bid with `_blindedBid` =
 keccak256(abi.encodePacked(value, fake, secret)).
 The sent ether is only refunded if the bid is correctly
 revealed in the revealing phase. The bid is valid if the
 ether sent together with the bid is at least "value" and
 "fake" is not true. Setting "fake" to true and sending
 not the exact amount are ways to hide the real bid but
 still make the required deposit. The same address can
 place multiple bids.
nodes.name: bid

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => struct BlindAuction.Bid storage ref[] storage ref)
struct BlindAuction.Bid storage ref[] storage ref
mapping(address => struct BlindAuction.Bid storage ref[] storage ref)
struct BlindAuction.Bid storage ref[] storage ref

nodes.documentation:
Reveal your blinded bids. You will get a refund for all
 correctly blinded invalid bids and for all bids except for
 the totally highest.
nodes.name: reveal

nodes.documentation: Withdraw a bid that was overbid.
nodes.name: withdraw

nodes.documentation:
End the auction and send the highest bid
 to the beneficiary.
nodes.name: auctionEnd

nodes.documentation:
End the auction and send the highest bid

nodes.name: auctionEnd

auctionEnd().notice: End the auction and send the highest bid to the beneficiary.

bid(bytes32).notice: Place a blinded bid with `_blindedBid` = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(value, fake, secret)). The sent ether is only refunded if the bid is correctly revealed in the revealing phase. The bid is valid if the ether sent together with the bid is at least "value" and "fake" is not true. Setting "fake" to true and sending not the exact amount are ways to hide the real bid but still make the required deposit. The same address can place multiple bids.

reveal(uint256[],bool[],bytes32[]).notice: Reveal your blinded bids. You will get a refund for all correctly blinded invalid bids and for all bids except for the totally highest.

withdraw().notice: Withdraw a bid that was overbid.
